bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 10, 1917

div1.p: Blue sends Carter to Colleton County, South Carolina, in order to investigate malaria conditions.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 10, 1917
div1.opener:
JC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
PAB
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 10, 1917.
Assistant Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
At the request of the State health authorities and in
connection with your investigations of impounded waters in
relation to malaria, you are hereby directed to proceed to
Colleton County, South Carolina, and vicinity, for the
purpose of investigating malaria conditions in the neighbor-
hood of the Salkehatchie swamps.

A report in duplicate of the results of your investi-
gation will be made to the Bureau. On the completion of
the duty enjoined, you will return to your station, Baltimore,
Md.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General. J S
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
R B
✓
